result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan David Hakes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Evan David Hakes is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Evan David Hakes was found guilty of Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 2, 3, 4 and 5.
Defendant to report to Probation September 10, 2015 by 3:00 p.m.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF69.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF69.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 45 days and follow recommendations of Agent.

-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as requested by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Marie Johnson.
-Submit a letter of apology within 30 days.
-Restorative Justice Program if requested by Victim.
-Maintain employment.
-Random UA's and PBT's.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA within 30 days and follow reommendations.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***

Defendant to be released today May 23, 2016.

Concurrent.
Court will not grant Huber at this time.
Concurrent with:
Unpaid costs to be converted into a civil judgment.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes Agent Volz also appeared.   DF ATTY:  Daniel James Chapman   DF:  Evan David Hakes appeared. Includes 15CF35, 15CF69 and 15CF591. Case called at 10:04 am. ADA Nieskes makes statements. Def will not contest the Motion on 15CF69. On 15CF35 Counts #2 and #4 and Count #1 in 15CF69, Agent Volz makes statement she is recommending to have sentences run concurrent. ADA Nieskes makes recommendations.   Atty Chapman responds. Defendant makes statement. Court revokes DJOC and enters conviction on Count #3 in 15CF35. Court orders:
- 15CF69 Count 1 - 4 months - concurrent
- 15CF35 Count 2 -  6 months - consecutive
- 15CF35 Count 4 - 30 Days concurrent 
- for a total of 10 months jail
- 107 Days credit
- Unpaid Costs to be converted to a civil judgment. 
- Court will not grant Huber at this time.
  Status conference scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Evan David Hakes appeared. Includes 15CF69 and 15CF35. Case called at 3:34 pm. ADA Nieskes recites agreement. No objection from Atty Perrin. ADA Nieskes moves to amend Count #1 in 15CF69 to Misdeameanor. Court amends. Court reviews constitutional rights with Def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one (Misdeameanor) in 15CF69,  Count #2, Count #3 and Count #4 in 15CF35 def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of amended count #1 in 15CF35, Count #2 and #4. Court withholds entering of conviction of Count #3 in favor of DJOC.  All other charges to be dismissed. Parties make sentencing arguements.

CO: C.A. Richards for Judge Vlack,REP: Drost, Clerk: Liddle.  ADA:  Michael E. Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Evan David Hakes appeared. Case called at 9:38 a.m. ADA Nieskes makes statement regarding Motion to Suppress.  State calls Officer Nick Krueger. S/T Officer Krueger with the St Croix Co. Sheriff's Dept. Direct by ADA Nieskes. Witness identifies defendant in the courtroom. Record reflects identification of the defendant. Cross by Atty Perrin. Witness is excused at 9:43 a.m. No further witnesses by either party. Argument by ADA Nieskes. Court is going to deny motions due to the testimony given today.  Status conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

and  SIGNATURE BOND:   __ Defendant and/or  _X_ Surety guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $4000.00  and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.
SURETY NAME/S: Jeff Richie

Includes 15CF35 and 15CF69

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jeffrey and Joann Richie.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Defendant to reside with Jeff Richie

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Marie Johnson.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Report every Wednesday and Saturday by 10:00 am to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Defendant to have GPS at his expense 

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
